subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text:

# [[road]]; [[way]]

subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|proper|どう|hhira=だう}}

# {{surname|lang=ja|sort=どう}}

subSections.title: Etymology 2
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|ち}}

subSections.title: Suffix
Etymology 3
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|じ}}

subSections.title: Suffix
Etymology 4
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|みち}}
Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|sort=みち|御|tr1=mi|pos1=honorific prefix|道|tr2=chi|t2=road, street, way}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> The prefix ''mi'' was in reference to the {{m|ja|神|tr=kami||god or spirit}} of roads.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|みち|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

subSections.title: Noun
Usage notes
subSections.text: This is the most common term for “road”, “street”, or “way” in modern Japanese.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Proper noun
Etymology 5
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr}}
Used as [[ateji]] in various names.

subSections.title: Proper noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|proper|おさむ|すすむ|ただし|ただす|なおし|まこと|みちひろ|もとい|わたる}}

# {{given name|male|lang=ja|sort=おさむ}}
